Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.

ALLEGATION:
Three residents had sexual contact outdoors while the supervising staff was
on his phone.
INVESTIGATION:
Resident C, age 14, was interviewed collaboratively with Government Worker 1. On
11/24/19, he said he and four residents were playing “Truth or Dare” in the cottage.
2

Resident B dared Resident A to “twerk.” Resident A dared Resident B to “bend over.”
Resident M dared Resident A to “pull out his stuff.” After that the boys went outdoors
on the playscape with Staff 1. First, they played “tag.” Then Resident B suggested they
play “Truth or Dare” at the top of the slide.
During the game, Resident C said Resident B sucked Resident A’s penis. Resident M
sucked Resident A’s penis and Resident A sucked Resident B’s penis. Resident C said
that Staff 1 was at the opposite end of the playscape, walking around the bench
listening to and looking down at his phone when this happened.
Resident M, age 11, was interviewed collaboratively with Government Worker 1 with
the Chief Administrator present for support. He would not sit down but chose to stand
at a distance from the interviewers. Resident M has speech difficulties and smirked
frequently.
Resident M said he and some boys were playing “Truth or Dare.” “Resident A told me
to ‘do whatever.’ I asked if that involved taking down his pants. Resident M smiled and
responded “Yes.” “Another kid did it too – Resident B.” I asked what Resident B did.
Resident M answered, “Resident B did what I did.” I asked if that involved private parts.
Resident M grinned “Maybe.” Then Resident M said Resident A “forced me.” Asked
how Resident A “forced” him, he could not explain.
Resident M was asked where the staff person was. He said he was sitting on a bench
far away and was on his phone the whole time. “It was dark outside,” he added.
Resident B, age 11, was interviewed collaboratively with Government Worker 1. He
said this is his first out-of-home placement and he has only been at Methodist for two
weeks.
Resident B was asked about the game of “Truth or Dare.” He downplayed the incident,
stating “We always play Truth or Dare.” He was asked if anyone was dared to take off
their clothes and he responded, “Yes.” “Resident M did it to Resident A.” Asked to
clarify, he acknowledged Resident M put his mouth on Resident A’s penis. He added,
“Resident M keeps saying I did, but Resident M lies about everything. He told Staff 2 I
did what he did. I was like, ‘Bro, you’re dumb.’”
Resident B was asked where the staff person was. He stated, “He (Staff 1) didn’t even
know (what happened).”
Resident A, age 12, was transferred to Muskegon River Youth Home the day after the
incident. He was interviewed by Government Worker 2 on 12/3/19. Resident A was
asked if he ever played outdoors at Methodist. He said he did. He was asked if
residents were allowed to play alone or had to be supervised by staff. He stated they
3

had to be supervised by staff. He was asked where the staff generally are when they
supervise residents outdoors. He said the staff sit in chairs, look at their phones and do
not pay attention. Resident A was asked if there were any residents at Methodist he did
not like. He said he did not like a few, but he did not volunteer names. Resident A was
asked if he had any problems with Residents B or M. He said he had problems with
them because they did something he did not like. He was asked what those residents
did. Resident A said it was sometimes "inappropriate.” He was asked to elaborate, but
he refused. Resident A did not want to talk about it. He did say that what Residents B
and M did, happened on the playscape when a staff person was not paying attention.
He did not say who that staff person was.
Resident A also said “it” happened right before he was moved to Muskegon River Youth
Home and that he did not tell anyone at Methodist about it. Then Resident A told
Government Worker 2 that he was done answering questions and the interview ended.
Resident S, age 13, was interviewed collaboratively with Government Worker 1. He
said Residents M, B, A and C were playing “Truth or Dare” outdoors on the playscape
on the ledge at the top of the slide “to give each other blow jobs.” “They did it a couple
of times. Resident M is in a relationship with Resident A.” Asked how he knows
Residents M and A are “in a relationship,” he said they were talking about it.
Resident S stated specifically that Resident B and M both gave Resident A “blow jobs.”
“Resident A was pushing Resident M’s head down. Resident M wanted to give
Resident C one on Sunday (two days ago).” I reported the potential “relationship” and
recent sexual request to the Chief Administrator for safety and treatment planning
purposes.
Asked where the staff person was, Resident S said Staff 1 was talking on his phone.
Staff 2 and 3 were interviewed separately and collaboratively with Government
Worker 1. Both staff said that the day after the incident, Resident M, C and S told them
similar accounts of what happened on the playscape.
Staff 1 was interviewed collaboratively with Government Worker 1. He was placed on
an administrative leave of absence from Methodist but came in for the interview. Staff 1
has worked weekends at the facility for one year. Full-time, he said he teaches history
and coaches at a charter school.
Government Worker 1 reviewed the allegations with Staff 1. He said he took the
residents outdoors to the playscape from 5:45pm to 5:57pm on 11/24/19. “I stood
directly in front of their faces. I was right there less than five feet away.” Staff 1 denied
being distracted from supervising the residents in any way. I asked him what the
children were doing on the playscape. “They were running back and forth…I never
4

turned my back on them,” he insisted. I asked Staff 1 if he carries a cell phone. He
said he has a cell phone but shuts it off at work.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff to perform the prescribed functions required by
these administrative rules and to provide for the needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: Outdoors on the playscape between 5pm – 6pm on 11/24/19,
there is evidence based on interviews that sexually
inappropriate behavior occurred between residents. Four of the
five residents involved reported that Staff 1 was supposed to be
supervising them but instead he stood at a distance from them
talking on and/or looking at his phone. The fifth resident
reported Staff 1 was unaware that anything inappropriate
happened.
Staff 1 did not provide for the needs, protection and supervision
of the residents.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION:
Once an appropriate corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
